title: Haro Saguaro Hardtail 29er
content:
Haro’s newest hardtail piqued our collective interests when we saw the press release. The Saguaro ($3,999.99 for Transmission GX or $1,899.99 for cable-actuated Saguaro 3) is a 6061 aluminum 29er hardtail with a 140mm travel fork, a 64.5º head angle, TRP 4-piston brakes, and GX Transmission. If the color didn’t grab your attention first, the build spec and geometry will.

Specs:

  • Hydroformed, heat-treated 6061-T6 aluminum hardtail frame.
  • Double-butted top and down tubes.
  • Internal cable routing.
  • Tapered head tube.
  • Modern geometry: 64.5 degree head tube angle with a longer front triangle and shorter rear end.
  • Fox 36 Performance Elite 140mm fork. Plenty of travel for steep, techy descents.
  • DT Swiss 32 hole aluminum wheel set. Sealed DT hubs with Boost thru-axles (15mm front, 12mm rear).
  • SRAM GX Transmission 12-speed drivetrain
  • Tubeless Kenda Pinner 29 X 2.4″ ATC (front)/Kenda Nevegal 2, 29 X 2.4″ATC (rear). Sealant included.
  • TranzX JD-YS135 RAD adjustable travel dropper post, size-specific per frame size
  • TRP Trail Evo 4-piston hydraulic brakes, 203mm rotor (front), 180mm rotor (rear)
  • Full 29er. Small size features “mullet” wheel configuration with 29″ front, 27.5″ rear

 

 

Check out more at Haro.
